extraEffects.effect: The target takes +1d6 damage from a claw swipe.
The target takes +2d6 damage from a claw swipe.

abilities.name: Savage
abilities.effect: The dire bear gains a +2 attack bonus against staggered enemies.

abilities.name: One dire feature
abilities.effect: Roll randomly unless you know this beast’s story already.

extraEffects.effect: The fire boar can make a bash attack against a different target as a free action.

attacks.name: Bash
attacks.damage: The target is weakened (-4 to attacks and defences) until the end of the boar’s next turn.

abilities.name: Bestial durability
abilities.effect: When an enemy’s attack has an effect on the dire boar other than damage, the boar can roll and immediate hard save (16+); on a success, it negates that effect.

abilities.name: Last stand
abilities.effect: The board doesn’t die until it reaches -60 hp.  While at 0 hp or below but more than -60 hp, it must roll a normal save at the end of each of its turns; on a failure it dies.

abilities.name: One random dire feature
abilities.effect: Use the dire features table or add something spicy.

nastierSpecials.name: Furious streak
nastierSpecials.effect: When the dire boar can make a bash attack, if it isn’t engaged with a different enemy, as a free action it can pop free of the enemy engaged with it and mvoe to a nearby enemy to make that bash attack.

nastierSpecials.name: Squealing pack attack
nastierSpecials.effect: This creature gains +1 attack bonus per other dire rat engaged with the target it’s attacking.

attacks.name: Pounce
attacks.damage: 38 damage, and the target is hampered while it’s engaged with the tiger

abilities.name: Pouncing opportunity
abilities.effect: When an enemy moves to engage the dire tiger while it’s unengaged, it can meet that enemy halfway and make a pounch attack as an interrupt action before the target’s attack.

abilities.name: Springing attack
abilities.effect: If the dire tiger is unengaged and moves to engage an enemy (with a springing leap), it can make a pounce attack as a standard action.

abilities.name: One random dire feature
abilities.effect: Use the dire features table.

extraEffects.effect: This creature gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage for each other ally engaged with the target (max +4 bonus).

abilities.name: Chilling howl
abilities.effect: Whenever a dire wolf’s attack drops an enemy to 0 hp or below, all dire wolves in the battle can howl as a free action.  When the wolves howl, each enemy in the battle takes a penalty to its attacks and all defences equal to the number of living dire wolves in the battle (max -5) until the end of the attacking wolf’s next turn.  New howls extend the duration of the current howl rather than downgrading the howl’s effect if dire wolves have been slain in the meantime.

abilities.name: One dire feature
abilities.effect: Roll randomly unless you know this beast’s story already.

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 1d3 ongoing acid damage.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A giant ant can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

attacks.name: Jagged claws
attacks.damage: 30 damage, and if the target’s initiative bonus is +10 or less, the target is grabbed until it disengages or until the mantis makes a jagged claws attack against a different target

abilities.name: Close fighting
abilities.effect: When an enemy fails a disengage check against the dire mantis, the mantis can make an opportunity attack against it.

abilities.name: Big but brittle
abilities.effect: While the dire mantis might rate as a huge monster in terms of size, its stats are based on those for a large monster.

abilities.name: One random dire feature
abilities.effect: Use the dire features table.

nastierSpecials.name: Clacking mandibles
nastierSpecials.effect: When the dire mantis starts its turn grabbing an enemy, it can make a chomp attack against that enemy as a free action.

attacks.name: Pincer
attacks.damage: 1 damage, and the scorpion gains a +2 attack bonus against the same target this turn with its stinger attack

extraEffects.effect: 2/round, each requiring a quick action. (Hitting the same target twice with pincer gives the string attack a +4 bonus.)
The target also takes 2d6 ongoing poison damage if it’s dazed or stuck.

attacks.name: Web
attacks.target: up to 2 nearby enemies in a group
attacks.damage: 3 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the spider’s next turn

extraEffects.effect: The target is also stuck until the end of the spider’s next turn.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A giant web spider can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 1d8 ongoing poison damage.

abilities.name: Scuttle
abilities.effect: A hunting spider can turn its own failed disengage check into a success by taking 1d4 damage.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A hunting spider can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

extraEffects.effect: This creature gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage for each other ally engaged with the target (max +4 damage).
If the target is small (i.e. a gnome or halfling), the ankheg grabs it. While the ankheg is grabbing a creature, the only legal target for its mandibles attack is the grabbed creature.

attacks.name: Acid spit
attacks.target: one nearby enemy, plus any enemy the ankheg has grabbed

extraEffects.effect: 1/round, as a quick action.

abilities.name: Escape speed
abilities.effect: At the end of the ankheg’s turn, roll a d6.  If it’s equal to or less than the escalation die, the ankheg can move again as a free action.

extraEffects.effect: 4 ongoing fire damage.

abilities.name: Blistering heat
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the azer attacks it, that enemy takes 2 fire damage.

abilities.name: Fighting surge
abilities.effect: Once per battle when an attack crits the azer but doesn’t kill it, the azer can heal 4d6 hp.

abilities.name: Cold haters
abilities.effect: The azer adds the escalation die to its attacks against a target that is capable of dealing cold damage with a spell, attack, or magic item.

abilities.name: Fire resistance 18+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

extraEffects.effect: The target takes 6 extra fire damage.

attacks.name: Molten spray
attacks.damage: 8 fire damage, and the brute loses 12 hit points

extraEffects.effect: 1/battle, only while the brute is staggered.

abilities.name: Blistering heat
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the brute attacks it, that enemy takes 2 fire damage.

abilities.name: Fire resistance 18+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Fiery flier
abilities.effect: An unengaged fire bat can move, and make a burning contrail attack, and move away from the target as a standard action without taking an opportunity attack from the target.

abilities.name: Blistering heat
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the fire bat attacks it, that enemy takes 2 fire damage.

abilities.name: Fire resistance 16+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Fire bats are agile fliers, especially when riding hot air currents.  They slow down a bit away from warmth.

extraEffects.effect: If both claws hit during the same turn, the bulette can make a terrible bite attack during its next turn as a standard action.
22 damage.

abilities.name: Blood frenzy
abilities.effect: The bulette’s crit range expands to 16+ while the escalation die is 4+.

abilities.name: Serious burrower
abilities.effect: A bulette can burrow incredibly quickly for short distances.  They’re renowned for the mounds of dirt and rock they push above them as they surge through the ground like land torpedoes.

nastierSpecials.name: Savage response
nastierSpecials.effect: When an attacker scores a critical hit against the bulette and it survives, the bulette can make a terrible bite attack as a free action against one target engaged with it.

extraEffects.effect: The target is dazed until the end of the chimera’s next turn from a headbutt.
The target takes 20 ongoing damage from raking claws.
The chimera makes a fiery breath attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Fiery breath
attacks.target: up to 3 nearby enemies in a group

abilities.name: Bestial thresher
abilities.effect: Whenever a creature misses the chimera with a melee attack, the chimera’s multiple sharp bits deal 3d10 damage to that attacker.

nastierSpecials.name: Now it’s angry
nastierSpecials.effect: When an attacker scores a critical hit against the chimera and it survives, its attack rolls on its next turn deal the effects of the lower rolls as well as their own results; for example, a roll 18-20 would daze the target and deal 20 ongoing damage as well as triggering fiery breath.

extraEffects.effect: The balor deals +1d20 lightning damage to the target and to one other nearby enemy of balor’s choice.  Then repeat that damage roll against the targets once for each point on the escalation die (so if it’s 4, that’s four more d20 rolls).
80 damage.

attacks.name: Flaming whip
attacks.damage: 50 fire damage, and the target is pulled to the balor, who engages it

extraEffects.effect: 25 fire damage.
1/round, as a quick action.

abilities.name: Desperate escalator
abilities.effect: White staggered, the balor adds the escalation die to its attack rolls.

abilities.name: Fiery aura
abilities.effect: At the start of the balor’s turn, each enemy engaged with it takes 4d10 fire damage; any die result of 10 is kept and the die rerolled.

abilities.name: Shadow and flame
abilities.effect: The balor gains +5 bonus to all defences against attacks by far away enemies.

nastierSpecials.name: Vorpal blade
nastierSpecials.effect: Critical hits with the abyssal blade deal triple damage instead of double damage.

extraEffects.effect: 3 damage.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Bat demons are indifferent fliers, better suited to gliding between stalactites and clinging to walls than to skillful flying.

abilities.name: Murder-pile
abilities.effect: At the start of each of the bat demon mob’s turns, choose one random nearby conscious enemy. All bat demons in the battle attempt to attack that enemy this turn, moving to it without disengaging and relying on their shifty ability to protect them. They keep attacking their target that turn even if it drops to 0 hp or below.

abilities.name: Shifty
abilities.effect: Bat demons gain a +5 AC bonus against opportunity attacks. In addition, they have resist damage 18+ against opportunity attacks (half damage if the natural attack roll isn’t 18+).

extraEffects.effect: The despoiler can pop free from the target.

attacks.name: Abyssal whispers
attacks.target: one nearby or far away enemy
attacks.damage: 15 psychic damage, and the target is confused (save ends); OR the target can choose to avoid the confusion effect by taking 6d6 psychic damage.

attacks.name: Sow discord
attacks.target: 2 nearby enemies engaged with the same creature or with each other
attacks.damage: One target makes an at-will melee attack against this power’s other target

extraEffects.effect: 1/day, as a quick action
The despoiler mage can pop free from the target.

attacks.name: Abyssal whispers
attacks.target: one nearby or far away enemy
attacks.damage: 45 psychic damage, and the target is confused (save ends); OR the target can choose to avoid the confusion effect by taking 10d10 psychic damage to clear their head…

attacks.name: Magic missile
attacks.target: one nearby or far away enemy

extraEffects.effect: 1/round, as a quick action.

attacks.name: Sow discord
attacks.target: 2 nearby enemies engaged with the same creature or with each other
attacks.damage: One target makes an at-will melee attack against this power’s other target

extraEffects.effect: 1/battle, as quick action.

abilities.name: Aura of betrayal
abilities.effect: At the start of each of the despoiler mage’s turns, choose a random nearby enemy.  Until the start of the despoiler mage’s next turn, that creature’s allies no longer consider it an ally, though its enemies’ powers can still target it as an enemy.  The creature isn’t compelled to attack its former friends.

abilities.name: Fear
abilities.effect: While engaged with this creature, enemies that have 15 hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

abilities.name: Raging frenzy
abilities.effect: Whenever the frenzy demon misses with a melee attack, it gains a +1 attack bonus and deals +1d4 damage until the end of the battle (maximum bonus +4, +4d4).

extraEffects.effect: The vrock can make a demonic screech attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Demonic screech
attacks.damage: 15 psychic damage, and the target is vulnerable (attacks vs. it have crit range expanded by 2) until the end of the battle

attacks.name: Sporeburst
attacks.damage: 30 damage, and 30 ongoing damage; while the target is taking ongoing damage, it is hampered

extraEffects.effect: 1/battle, when the escalation die is 4+.

abilities.name: Predation
abilities.effect: Creatures hit by the vrock’s demonic screech attack that are already vulnerable are also hampered (save ends).

extraEffects.effect:
The demon can grab the target as long as it isn’t already grabbing a creature. The grabbed foe can’t move except to teleport, pop free, or attempt to disengage, and disengage attempts take a -5 penalty unless the creature hit the glabrezou with an attack that turn.
 The glabrezou gains a +4 attack bonus against any enemy it is grabbing.

attacks.name: Painbolt
attacks.target: one nearby or far away creature

attacks.name: Hellfire
attacks.target: 1d3 nearby enemies in a group and any glabrezou allies engaged with those enemies

abilities.name: Mirror images
abilities.effect: At will, as a move action, a glabrezou can create multiple images of itself that make it harder to target.  The next time an attack would hit the glabrezou, the attacker has to roll 11+ with another d20 roll: success indicates a hit; failure is a miss that hits one of the mirror images instead, dealing no miss damage to the glabrezou but dispelling all the images.

abilities.name: Mirror images whilst staggered
abilities.effect: Once the glabrezou is staggered, it takes 2d10 damage whenever it uses mirror image, so movement or escape start registering as alternatives.

abilities.name: Power word stun
abilities.effect: Once per day as a free action, the glabrezou can utter a word of power, canceling a single action just taken by a nearby creature with fewer hit points than the glabrezou - whether it was casting a spell, healing an ally, or whatever. The GM can see the results of the action, such as a die roll, before deciding whether to use the power word.

extraEffects.effect:
The demon can grab the target if it isn’t already grabbing a creature. The grabbed foe can’t move except to teleport, pop free, or attempt to disengage, and disengage attempts take a -5 penalty unless the creature hit the hezrou with an attack that turn.
 The hezrou gains a +4 attack bonus against any enemy it is grabbing.

abilities.name: Demonic stench
abilities.effect: While engaged with this creature, enemies with 84hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

nastierSpecials.name: Abyssal sergeant
nastierSpecials.effect: Lower-level non-mook demons nearby the hezrou deal damage equal to their level when they miss with an attack.

nastierSpecials.name: Stab this now
nastierSpecials.effect: The hezrou’s allies gain a +4 attack bonus against any creature it is grabbing.

extraEffects.effect: The hooked demon can make another hooks and barbs attack as a free action (and yes, this can keep going up to a maximum number of attacks equal to the escalation die + 1).

nastierSpecials.name: Bleeding wounds
nastierSpecials.effect: Whenever the hooked demon hits a creature with hooks and barbs, that creature takes 10 damage each time it makes a non-basic attack (save ends).

attacks.name: Blight jet
attacks.damage: 7 damage, and the target is dazed (save ends)

extraEffects.effect: The imp can choose one: the target is weakened instead of dazed; OR the imp can make a blight jet attack against a different target as a free action.

abilities.name: Curse aura
abilities.effect: Whenever a creature attacks the imp and rolls a natural 1-5, that creature takes 1d10 psychic damage.

attacks.name: Six whirling swords
attacks.damage: 30 damage, and the marilith can pop free from the target after the attacks

attacks.name: Beguiling gaze
attacks.target: one nearby or far away unengaged enemy
attacks.damage: As a free action, the target immediately moves toward the marilith, attempting to engage it or get as close as possible to it

extraEffects.effect: 1/round, as a quick action.

abilities.name: Terrible swift swords
abilities.effect: The marilith’s crit range with melee attacks expands by a number equal to the escalation die.

extraEffects.effect: The nalfeshnee gains a +4 attack bonus until it hits.  Unlike most effects, let it stack.

attacks.name: Accursed burst
attacks.damage: 50 cold/fire/lightning/negative energy damage (your choice), and the nalfeshnee can make an abyssal curse attack as a free action

attacks.name: Abyssal curse
attacks.damage: The target is weakened until the end of its next turn

abilities.name: Unpredictable
abilities.effect: Nalfeshnee always have at least two random demon abilities.

nastierSpecials.name: Hooked mooks
nastierSpecials.effect: Once per battle, if the nalfeshnee is staggered, it can gat in 2d4 hooked demons as a quick action.  Roll initiative for the hooked demons; they do not appear in the battle and take their turns until their next initiative count comes up.

extraEffects.effect: The vrock can make a demonic screech attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Demonic screech
attacks.damage: 5 psychic damage, and the target is vulnerable (attacks vs. it have crit range expanded by 2) until the end of the battle

nastierSpecials.name: Predation
nastierSpecials.effect: Creatures hit by the vrock’s demonic screech attack that are already vulnerable are also hampered (save ends).

extraEffects.effect: The derro can cast one of the following close-quarters spells as a quick action this turn.
All nearby derro gain a +1 bonus to attacks and defences until the end of the derro maniac’s next turn (cumulative).
Two random nearby non-derro creatures take 2d4 thunder damage.
The target also takes 5 ongoing poison damage
As above, and the derro maniac can make another light repeating crossbow attack as a free action.
The derro can cast one of the following close-quarters spells as a quick action this turn.
All nearby derro gain a +1 bonus to attacks and defences until end of the derro sage’s next turn (cumulative).
Two random nearby non-derro creatures take 2d8 thunder damage.

attacks.name: Mind scream
attacks.damage: 12 psychic damage, and the target is confused (make a basic or at-will attack vs. ally) until the end of the derro sage’s next turn

extraEffects.effect: The derro sage can make another mind scream attack against a different nearby target as a free action.

nastierSpecials.name: Group gibbering
nastierSpecials.effect: The derro sage starts a group of derro gibbering as a quick action.  It can maintain the gibber as a free action at the start of each turn by taking 1 damage.  Each nearby non-derro creature that hears the gibber must roll a d6 at the start of its turn and takes psychic damage equal to the die roll or to the number of gibbering derro, whichever is lower.

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 15 ongoing acid damage.
20 damage.

attacks.name: Acid breath
attacks.damage: 50 acid damage, and 15 ongoing acid damage

extraEffects.effect: 4d12 acid damage.

abilities.name: Draconic grace
abilities.effect:
At the start of each of the huge black dragon’s turns, roll a d4 to see if it gets an extra standard action. If the roll is equal to or less than the escalation die, the black dragon can take an extra standard action that turn.
 After the first sucess, the grace die bumps up to a d6. After the second success, it’s a d8, then a d10 after the third success. The fourth success is a d12, and finally a d20 after the fifth one.

abilities.name: Intermittent breath
abilities.effect: A huge black dragon can use acid breath 2d3 times per battle, but never two turns in a row.

abilities.name: Water-breathing
abilities.effect: Black dragons swim well and can breathe underwater.

abilities.name: Resist acid 18+
abilities.effect: When an acid attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

extraEffects.effect: The dragon can make a bite attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.damage: 60 damage, and 4d10 lightning damage to the target and to one other nearby enemy of the dragon’s choice

extraEffects.effect: The target is also dazed (save ends).  After the target saves, it takes a -1 attack penalty (non-cumulative) until its next full heal-up (because it’s vibrating slightly out of synch with the rest of the world).

abilities.name: Intermittent breath
abilities.effect: A huge blue dragon can use far slashing lightning breath 2d4 times per battle, but never two turns in a row.

abilities.name: Counter-spell
abilities.effect: When an enemy targets the blue dragon with a spell, the dragon can roll a save; success means the spell has no effect on the dragon.  If the level of the spell is lower than the dragon’s level, it’s a normal save (11+).  Against an equal or higher-level spell, the save is a hard save (16+).  If the dragon is staggered, the save target increases by +5 (normal becomes hard, hard becomes 21+: impossible unless the dragon has a save bonus from some other source).

abilities.effect: When a lightning attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

attacks.name: Web attack
attacks.target: up to 2 nearby enemies in a group

extraEffects.effect: 1/round as a quick action, if the escalation die is even.

attacks.name: First big swing
attacks.damage: 25 damage, and the target pops free from the ettin; then as a free action, the ettin can move (or choose not to move) and make a second swing attack.

abilities.name: Two-headed save
abilities.effect: If an ettin’s first save against an effect fails, it can roll a second save.

nastierSpecials.name: Big bully
nastierSpecials.effect: The ettin deals double damage with its attacks againt staggered enemies.

nastierSpecials.name: Escalating agreement
nastierSpecials.effect: If the escalation die is 3+, the ettin can target two engaged enemies with its first big swing attack.

extraEffects.effect: The gargoyle can make two more melee attacks as a free action (but never more than three total attacks per standard action, even if you roll another 11+).

nastierSpecials.name: Rocky hide
nastierSpecials.effect: The gargoyle has resist damage 12+ against attacks targeting AC.

nastierSpecials.name: Statues, statues, everywhere
nastierSpecials.effect: Because they often look like statues, gargoyles are capable of springing a surprise on inattentive PCs.  When there’s a chance of such an ambush, give the PCs a champion-tier skill check (DC 20) to notice the gargoyles and avoid being surprised.

extraEffects.effect: The target is vulnerable (attacks vsd. it have crit range expanded by 2) to attacks by undead until the end of the ghoul’s next turn.

abilities.name: Pound of flesh
abilities.effect: The newly-risen ghoul’s scrabbling claws attack deals +2 damage against vulnerable targets.

extraEffects.effect: The target is vulnerable (attacks vs. it have crit range expanded by 2) to attacks by undead until the end of the ghoul’s next turn.

abilities.name: Pound of flesh
abilities.effect: The ghoul’s claws and bite attack deals +4 damage against vulnerable targets.

abilities.name: Infected bite
abilities.effect: Any creature that is slain by a ghoul and not consumed will rise as a ghoul the next night.

nastierSpecials.name: Paralysing bite
nastierSpecials.effect: When the ghoul hits a vulnerable target with a natural even attack roll, the target is also stunned (save ends).

attacks.name: Sleep, little ones
attacks.target: one nearby enemy, or 1d3 nearby enemies in a group if the escalation die is 3+
attacks.damage: 20 psychic damage, and if the target has 50 hp or fewer after the attack, it falls unconscious (hard save ends, 16+; it also ends if the target takes 10 or more damage)

attacks.name: Zzzzzottttttttttt!
attacks.damage: 35 force damage, and 35 ongoing lightning damage

extraEffects.effect: 20 force damage, and 20 ongoing lightning damage.

abilities.name: Strike with advantage
abilities.effect: A cloud giant gains a +4 attack bonus against any enemy taking ongoing damage or that has an ongoing condition (unconscious sleep, for instance).

extraEffects.effect: The target loses any flight abilities and can’t gain flight in any way (save ends).
The than can make a chains and shrapnel attack as a free action.

abilities.name: Strike with advantage
abilities.effect: A cloud giant gains a +4 attack bonus against any enemy taking ongoing damage or that has an ongoing condition (dazed, for instance).

extraEffects.effect: The target is dazed (save ends).

attacks.name: Hurled spear
attacks.target: up to 3 enemies in a group with a single spear

abilities.name: Strike with advantage
abilities.effect: A cloud giant gains a +4 attack bonus against any enemy taking ongoing damage or that has an ongoing condition (dazed, for instance).

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 10 ongoing fire damage.
The target also takes 10 ongoing fire damage.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.damage: 10 damage, the target pops free from the giant, and the target loses its next move action.

abilities.name: Fiery escalator
abilities.effect: The fire giant adds the escalation die to its attacks against targets taking ongoing fire damage.

abilities.name: Resist fire 16+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Burning blood
nastierSpecials.effect: When a fire giant becomes staggered, it deals 10 ongoing fire damage to each enemy engaged with it.

nastierSpecials.name: Strength of giants
nastierSpecials.effect: Twice per battle, the giant can make a slam attack as a quick action (once per round).

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 10 ongoing fire damage.

abilities.name: Fiery escalator
abilities.effect: The fire giant warlord adds the escalation die to its attacks against targets taking ongoing fire damage.

abilities.name: Resist fire 16+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Warlord of fire
abilities.effect: As a standard action, the warlord can command one nearby ally that has resistance to fire to make a melee attack as a free action.

nastierSpecials.name: Unquenchable fires
nastierSpecials.effect: Enemies engaged with the first giant warlord take a -5 penalty to saves against ongoing fire damage.

extraEffects.effect: The giant can make a frost touch attack against the target as a free action.

attacks.name: Frost touch
attacks.damage: 10 cold damage, and the target is hampered (makes only basic attacks) until the end of its next turn

attacks.name: Large rock or iceball
attacks.target: one nearby enemy or far away enemy at -2 atk

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.damage: 20 damage, the target pops free from the giant, and the target loses its next move action

abilities.name: Ancient cold
abilities.effect: Whilte battling one or more frost giants, there is only a 50% chance that the escalation die increases at the start of the round.

abilities.name: Resist cold 16+
abilities.effect: When a cold attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Strength of giants
nastierSpecials.effect: Twice per battle, the giant can make a slam attack as a quick action (once per round).

extraEffects.effect: Half damage (sometimes close is good enough).

nastierSpecials.name: Big bully
nastierSpecials.effect: The giant deals double damage with its attacks against staggered targets.

extraEffects.effect: The giant can make a lightning bolt attack against a random nearby enemy as a free action.
40 damage OR the giant can make a release the thunder attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Giant longbow
attacks.target: 2 attacks vs. nearby or far away enemies

extraEffects.effect: The giant can make a lightning bolt attack against a random enemy that is nearby the target of the longbow attack.
Half damage.

attacks.name: Release the thunder
attacks.damage: 1d10 thunder damage per building thunder point (see below)

extraEffects.effect: Half damage.

abilities.name: Building thunder
abilities.effect: Keep count of the number of times the storm giant uses its lightning bolt attack during the battle. Add that number to the escalation die to get the current building thunder value.

abilities.name: Skystep
abilities.effect: A storm giant can use its standard action to walk or run through the air, using move actions to continue.  If the storm giant makes a standard action attack, it settles back to the ground below it without falling.

abilities.name: Storm born
abilities.effect: The storm giant has resist thunder 16+ and resist lightning 16+.

extraEffects.effect: If more than one gnoll is engaged with the target, each gnoll melee attack that misses that target deals half damage.
The gnoll can make a second longbow attack (no more) as a free action.

abilities.name: Quick shot
abilities.effect: When the gnoll ranger is unengaged and an enemy moves to engage it, roll a d20. On a 11+ the gnoll ranger can make a longbow attack against that enemy as a free action just before being engaged.

nastierSpecials.name: Hates everyone
nastierSpecials.effect: The crit range of attacks by gnoll rangers expands by 2 against humanoids.

extraEffects.effect: If more than one gnoll is engaged with the target, each gnoll melee attack that misses that target deals half damage.
The target is marked for death; until the end of the battle, all gnoll attacks against the target gain an attack bonus equal to the escalation die.
If more than one gnoll is engaged with the target, each gnoll melee attack that misses that target deals half damage.
The attack deals +5 damage.
If the target is engaged with two or more foes, it takes 1d8 damage.

attacks.name: Club
attacks.damage: 6 damage if the goblins and their allies outnumber their enemies; 4 damage if they don’t

abilities.name: Shifty bugger
abilities.effect: Goblins gain a +5 bonus to disengage checks.

abilities.name: Shifty bugger
abilities.effect: Goblins gain a +5 bonus to disengage checks.

attacks.name: Shaking curse
attacks.damage: 8 damage, and until the end of the shaman’s next turn, the target takes 2 damage whenever an enemy engages it or disengages from it

extraEffects.effect: Choose another nearby enemy; it also suffers from the engage/disengage effect until the end of the shaman’s next turn.

abilities.name: Shifty bugger
abilities.effect: Goblins only need to roll a 6+ to disengage.

extraEffects.effect: Until the start of its next turn, the first time an attack would hit the hobgoblin captain, it can partially avoid that attack if it has a nearby goblin ally.  It only takes half damage from the attack, and that ally takes the rest.

abilities.name: Group ability
abilities.effect: For every two hobgoblins in the battle (round up, ignore mooks), one of them can use well-armoured as a free action once during the battle.

abilities.name: Well-armoured (group)
abilities.effect: Ignore all damage from a hit (but not a crit) against AC.

attacks.name: Fireblast
attacks.target: up to 2 nearby enemies in a group
attacks.damage: 10 fire damage (or 20 if used against a single target), and the target loses its next move action

attacks.name: Concussive blast
attacks.target: all enemies engaged with the warmage
attacks.damage: 10 force damage, and the warmage pops the target off of it

extraEffects.effect: The target is also dazed (save ends).

abilities.name: Group ability
abilities.effect: For every two hobgoblins in the battle (rounded up, ignore mooks), one of them can use well-armoured as a free action once during the battle.

abilities.name: Well-armoured (group)
abilities.effect: Ignore all damage from a hit (but not a crit) against AC.

extraEffects.effect: A non-dwarf creature damaged by a clay golem can’t be healed to above half its maximum hit points until after the battle.

abilities.name: Golem immunity
abilities.effect: Non-organic golems are immune to effects.  They can’t be dazed, weakened, confused, made vulnerable, or touched by ongoing damage.  You can damage a golem, but that’s about it.

abilities.name: Ignore attacks 11+
abilities.effect: When an attack hits this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 11+ on the attack roll or it missed instead. That’s all attacks.

attacks.name: Maddened battlefield repairs
attacks.damage: 20 damage, and the flesh golem heals 2d10 hit points

extraEffects.effect: 10 damage, and the flesh golem heals 1d10 hit points.
The flesh golem can only use this attack while it’s staggered.

abilities.name: Energy magnet
abilities.effect: Whenever a spell causes cold, fire, force, lightning, or negative energy damage targets one of the flesh golem’s nearby allies, the flesh golem has a 50% chance of becoming the main target instead.  Therefore spells that affect groups would spread out from the flesh golem.

abilities.name: Weakness of the flesh
abilities.effect: Flesh golems are not immune to effects.

extraEffects.effect: 5d10 damage.

abilities.name: Golem immunity
abilities.effect: Non-organic golems are immune to effects.  They can’t be dazed, weakened, confused, made vulnerable, or touched by ongoing damage.  You can damage a golem, but that’s about it.

abilities.name: Rampage
abilities.effect: At the start of each of the iron golem’s turns, roll a d6. If the roll is equal to or less than the escalation die, the iron golem goes on a rampage that turn. Instead of its two normal fists of iron attacks, it can make three attacks with fists of iron, each against a different random nearby creature, enemy or ally. It can move after each such attack as a free action, if necessary, taking only half damage from opportunity attacks during the rampage.

nastierSpecials.name: Poison gas
nastierSpecials.effect: The first time the iron golem is staggered, poison gas leaks from it into the area. It can make a poison gas cloud attack as a free action.

extraEffects.effect: 15 damage.

attacks.name: Finishing smash
attacks.damage: 80 damage, and the golem pops the target off it and moves it a short distance away from the golem

extraEffects.effect: 20 damage, and the target is hampered (save ends).
20 damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

abilities.name: Golem immunity
abilities.effect: Non-organic golems are immune to effects.  They can’t be dazed, weakened, confused, made vulnerable, or touched by ongoing damage.  You can damage a golem, but that’s about it.

nastierSpecials.name: Former idol
nastierSpecials.effect: Evoke the powers of an ancient culture’s strange rites by giving the stone golem any weird power you wish. If you’re stuck for inspiration, consider starting with random abilities from the demons that aren’t related to energy or the cone of cold from the ogre mage.

extraEffects.effect: One nearby lower-level mook makes an attack as a free action.
The half-orc commander gains 20 temporary hit points.

abilities.name: Orcish command
abilities.effect: When a nearby ally of the half-orc commander scores a critical hit, that ally can roll a save against a save ends effect as a free action.

extraEffects.effect: The half-orc legionnaire gains a +2 bonus to all defences until the start of its next turn.
The target takes +1d6 damage.
4 damage.

The tribal champion heals 5 hp.
10 damage.

abilities.name: Tribal rage
abilities.effect: When the escalation die is even, a tribal champion can roll two d20 for each melee attack roll it makes and use the result it prefers.  If both dice are 11+, the melee attack is a critical hit.

extraEffects.effect: The harpy gains a +5 bonus to attack and damage with this attack against any enemy suffering from any fiendish song effect.
The target is hampered (easy save ends, 6+)

abilities.name: Resist fire 16+

nastierSpecials.name: Fiery aura
nastierSpecials.effect: Each creature engaged with a hellhound at the start of its turn takes 2d6 fire damage.

attacks.name: Demon bow
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and the target is dazed (-4 attack) until it pulls the arrow out using a quick action, which deals 10 ongoing damage

extraEffects.effect: The demon bow eats at the ranger’s arm and the ranger takes 1d6 damage.

attacks.name: Demon bow
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and the target is dazed (-4 attack) until it pulls the arrow out using a quick action, which deals 10 ongoing damage

extraEffects.effect: The demon bow eats at the ranger’s arm and the ranger takes 1d6 damage.

abilities.name: Bow teeth
abilities.effect: Whenever an attacker hits the ranger with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d6 damage as the bow chews on it.

extraEffects.effect: The thug deals +6 damage with its next attack this battle.
If the target is taking ongoing psychic damage, the attack deals +2d6 damage.
While the target is taking the ongoing psychic damage, it is dazed (-4 attack).
While the target is taking the ongoing psychic damage, it is confused instead of dazed.

abilities.name: Group ability
abilities.effect: For every two hungry stars in the battle (round up), one of them can use warp-pulse once during the battle.

abilities.name: Limited flight
abilities.effect: Hungry stars flap and glide and hover, always within seven or eight feet of the ground.

extraEffects.effect: The hydra’s next gnashing teeth attack, if it has an attack left this turn, can be against any nearby enemy instead of against a creature engaged with it.
5 damage.

abilities.name: Too tough to trick
abilities.effect: Whenever the hydra would suffer any of the following conditions, it ignores the condition and takes 5 damage instead: confused, dazed, hampered, stunned, or weakened.

abilities.name: Roiling swirl
abilities.effect: If the hydra has at least two gnashing teeth attacks left during a turn, it can expend one of those attacks to move to engage a nearby enemy as a free action (but it will take opportunity attacks to do so).

abilities.name: Sprout sixth head
abilities.effect: The first time the hydra is staggered, as a free action it gains 40 hit points and a sixth gnashing teeth attack, and is considered undamaged at its new hit point total. Using the hydra’s current hit points as a new baseline, the hydra will be staggered again when it drops below 50% of that total.

abilities.name: Sprout seventh head
abilities.effect: The second time the hydra is staggered, as a free action it gains 40 hit points and a seventh gnashing teeth attack, etc. Use a new hit point baseline as before, but there is no eighth head waiting to sprout.

nastierSpecials.name: Sprout eighth head
nastierSpecials.effect: You know the drill.

extraEffects.effect: The hydra’s next gnashing teeth attack, if it has an attack left this turn, can be against any nearby enemy instead of against a creature engaged with it.
7 damage.
Half damage.

abilities.name: Too tough to trick
abilities.effect: Whenever the hydra would suffer any of the following conditions, it ignores the condition and takes 5 damage instead: confused, dazed, hampered, stunned, or weakened.

abilities.name: Roiling swirl
abilities.effect: If the hydra has at least two gnashing teeth attacks left during a turn, it can expend one of those attacks to move to engage a nearby enemy as a free action (but it will take opportunity attacks for doing so).

abilities.name: Sprout eighth head
abilities.effect: The first time the hydra is staggered, as a free action it gains 50 hit points and a eighth gnashing teeth attack, and is considered undamaged at its new hit point total. Using the hydra’s current hit points as a new baseline, the hydra will be staggered again when it drops below 50% of that total.

abilities.name: Sprout ninth head
abilities.effect: The second time the hydra is staggered, as a free action it gains 50 hit points and a ninth gnashing teeth attack, etc. Use a new hit point baseline as before, but there is no tenth head waiting to sprout.

abilities.name: Resist opportunity attacks 16+
abilities.effect: When an opportunity attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Pyrohydra
nastierSpecials.effect: When the hydra gets a natural even attack roll with a gnashing teeth attack, its next attack that turn (if it has one) is a flame breath attack instead. Note that flame breath attacks don’t lead to other flaming breaths; the hydra has to return to making a gnashing teeth attack first.

abilities.name: Evasive
abilities.effect: Kobolds take no damage from missed attacks.

abilities.name: Split off
abilities.effect: When one of the kobold’s allies engages a creature engaged with the kobold, the kobold can pop free as a free action.

attacks.name: Shortsword
attacks.damage: 6 damage, and each nearby non-leader kobold deals +3 damage with its next attack this battle that hits

abilities.effect: Kobolds take no damage from missed attacks.

abilities.name: Evasive
abilities.effect: Kobolds take no damage from missed attacks.

abilities.name: Not brave

extraEffects.effect: The lizardman savage can make a bite attack against the target or another creature engaged with it as a free action.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.damage: 5 damage, and the lizardman savage can make a ripping frenzy attack against the target as a standard action during its next turn if it’s engaged with that target

extraEffects.effect: The manticore can make a single volley of tail spikes attack (one attack roll) against a different target as a free action.

attacks.name: Crushing leonine jaws
attacks.damage: 30 damage; OR 50 damage against a creature taking ongoing poison damage

attacks.name: Volley of tail spikes
attacks.target: 1d3 nearby or far away enemies in a group

abilities.name: Poison reservoirs
abilities.effect: Each time the manticore uses its volley of tail spikes attack, it takes 1d6 damage, or 2d6 if it is staggered.

extraEffects.effect: The medusa can make a petrifying gaze attack against the target as a free action.

attacks.name: Lightning fork
attacks.target: one nearby or far away enemy

extraEffects.effect: The medusa deals 1d6 × 10 lightning damage to all nearby enemies.

The medusa can make a lightning fork attack against a different target as a free action; keep making lightning fork attacks until you run out of targets that have taken damage from lightning fork or roll a natural odd attack.

attacks.name: Petrifying gaze
attacks.damage: 70 psychic damage, and the target must start making last gasp saves as it turns to stone

abilities.name: Caught by an eye
abilities.effect: Whenever a nearby enemy attacks the medusa noble and rolls a natural 1-5, the medusa can make a petrifying gaze attack against that attacker as a free action.

abilities.name: Serpent wardings
abilities.effect: Thrice per battle, as a free action, the medusa noble can force an enemy to reroll a spell attack that targeted it.  The attacker can’t use the escalation die for the reroll.

abilities.name: Skilled sorcerer
abilities.effect: If lightning isn’t working against her target, the medusa noble can take a -2 attack penalty to change the energy type of her ranged attack to fire or thunder.

extraEffects.effect: The medusa can make a petrifying gaze attack against the target as a free action.

attacks.name: Poison arrow
attacks.target: one nearby or far away enemy

extraEffects.effect: The medusa can make a petrifying gaze attack against the target as a free action.

attacks.name: Petrifying gaze
attacks.damage: 20 psychic damage, and the target must start making last gasp saves as it turns to stone

abilities.name: Caught by an eye
abilities.effect: Whenever a nearby enemy attacks the medusa outlaw and rolls a natural 1 or 2, the medusa can make a petrifying gaze attack against that attacker as a free action.

abilities.name: Escalating threat
abilities.effect: At the start of each of the medusa’s turns, roll a d4. If you roll less than or equal to the escalation die, the medusa can also use petrifying gaze as a quick action once during that turn.

attacks.name: Axe or horns
attacks.damage: 27 damage, and one of the minotaur’s allies can pop free from the target as a free action

extraEffects.effect: The attack instead deals 40 damage on a hit if the minotaur first moves before attacking an enemy it was not engaged with at the start of its turn.

abilities.name: Blood frenzy
abilities.effect: Minotaurs gain a +4 melee attack bonus against staggered enemies.

nastierSpecials.name: Durable
nastierSpecials.effect: The first time each round the minotaur takes damage, prevent 2d6 of it.

nastierSpecials.name: Fear
nastierSpecials.effect: While engaged with this creature, enemies that have 24 hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

extraEffects.effect: Half damage

attacks.name: Big shove
attacks.damage: 1d6 damage, and the target pops free from the ogre

extraEffects.effect: This power only requires a quick action (once per round) instead of a standard action when the escalation die is even.

nastierSpecials.name: Tough skin
nastierSpecials.effect: Whenever the ogre takes weapon damage, reduce that damage by 1d8 points.

extraEffects.effect: Make a second naginata attack against a nearby enemy as a free action (engaging it is not required)

attacks.name: Cone of cold
attacks.target: up to 3 nearby enemies in a group

extraEffects.effect: 1/day, and the attack affects the ogre’s allies engaged with or between enemy targets.

attacks.name: Aura of treachery
attacks.damage: The target is confused until the end of the ogre mage’s next turn

abilities.name: Aura of treachery
abilities.effect: Once per round when a nearby enemy misses the ogre mage with an attack, the ogre mage can make an aura of treachery attack against it as a free action.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: The ogre mage flies using the sheer power of its superior mind.

abilities.name: Invisibility
abilities.effect: If the ogre mage is not engaged, it can turn invisible as an at-will standard action. It becomes visible when it attacks. The ogre mage takes 1d10 damage each time it uses invisibility while it’s staggered.

abilities.name: Resist exceptional attacks 16+
abilities.effect: When a limited attack (not an at-will attack) targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Trollish regeneration 20
abilities.effect:
While an ogre mage is damaged, its uncanny flesh heals 20 hit points at the start of the ogre mage’s turn. It can regenerate five times per battle. If it heals to its maximum hit points, then that use of regeneration doesn’t count against the five-use limit.
 When the ogre mage is hit by an attack that deals fire or acid damage, it loses one use of its regeneration, and it can’t regenerate during its next turn.
 Dropping an ogre mage to 0 hp doesn’t kill it if it has any uses of regeneration left.

attacks.name: Acid-drenched pseudopod
attacks.target: up to 4 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy
attacks.damage: 30 acid damage, and 10 ongoing acid damage

extraEffects.effect: 10 acid damage.

abilities.name: Climber
abilities.effect: A black pudding sticks to ceilings and walls when it wishes, sliding along as easily as on the floor.

abilities.name: Slippery
abilities.effect: The pudding has resist weapons 12+.

attacks.name: Shlup’n’schlorp
attacks.damage: 30 acid damage, and the cube engulfs the target (functions like a grab) if it’s smaller than the cube

extraEffects.effect: The cube can make a spasms attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Spasms
attacks.target: up to 2 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy

abilities.name: Engulf and dissolve
abilities.effect:
Targets engulfed/grabbed by the cube take 30 acid damage at the start of the cube’s turn but are not viable targets for additional attacks by the cube. Multiple targets can be held within the cube simultaneously.
 Any engulfed creature that is also staggered must begin making last gasp saves or become paralysed as the cube’s toxins overwhelm it.

attacks.name: Acid-drenched pseudopod
attacks.target: 1d4 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy

extraEffects.effect: 3 ongoing acid damage.

abilities.name: Splitter
abilities.effect: The first time an ochre jelly takes 20 or more damage from a single attack, it splits into two normal-size ochre jellies, each with half the original’s current hit points plus 2d6 hp. Treat the new jellies as undamaged jellies at their new hit point totals without the splitter ability.

extraEffects.effect: The cadre can make a second double axe attack (no more) as a free action.
The crit range of melee attacks by great fang cadre orcs expands by 3 until half the great fang cadre mob has been dropped.
The attack targets PD instead of AC.

nastierSpecials.name: On the spot mutation
nastierSpecials.effect: Whenever an attack eliminates one or more members of the mob, there is a 50% chance that each survivor gains one of these abilities: extra melee attack, damage aura: 1d20 damage vs. any enemy that starts its turn engaged with the orc, or +4 to AC.

extraEffects.effect: The crit range of attacks by orcs expands by 3 unless they are staggered.

abilities.name: Unstoppable
abilities.effect: When an orc berserker drops to 0 hp, it does not immediately die.  Ignore any damage in excess of 0 hp, roll 2d6, and give the berserker that many temporary hit points.  No other healing can affect the berserker or give it more temporary hit points.  When the temporary hp are gone, the berserker dies.

extraEffects.effect: The crit range of attacks by orcs expands by 3 unless they are staggered.

attacks.name: Battle curse
attacks.damage: 4 psychic damage, and for the rest of the battle, melee attacks by orcs deal +1d4 damage against the target (non-cumulative)

extraEffects.effect: The crit range of attacks by orcs expands by 3 unless they are staggered.
The otyugh can grab the target.
The otyugh can grab the target and make a big toothy maw attack against it as a free action.

attacks.name: Big toothy maw
attacks.target: one enemy it’s grabbing; includes +4 grab bonus

abilities.name: Trash nest defence
abilities.effect: The otyugh gains a +2 bonus to all defences while fighting in its nest or in similar piles of excrement and trash.

abilities.name: Tentacle flail
abilities.effect: Once per round, an otyugh can make a grasping tentacles attack as a free action against a moving nearby creature it is not engaged with; on a natural even hit, the target is grabbed and its movement stops.

attacks.name: Rip and peck
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and until the end of the owlbear’s next turn, the target is hampered (makes only basic attacks) while engaged with the owlbear

extraEffects.effect: If the escalation die is even, make another rip and peck attack.

abilities.name: Feed the cubs
abilities.effect: An owlbear that scores a critical hit against a hampered enemy tears a piece of the creature off (GM chooses a limb) and will subsequently attempt to retreat with the prize to feed its cubs.  The torn-up enemy is stunned until the end of its next turn.

abilities.name: Silent hunter
abilities.effect: Owlbears are nearly silent until they strike.  Checks to hear them approaching take a -5 penalty.

extraEffects.effect: The spider can make a rummage and filch attack against the target as a free action, even if the target isn’t staggered.

attacks.name: Rummage and filch
attacks.damage: The phase spider steals a random true magic item from the target (see below)

abilities.name: Phasing abilities
abilities.effect: As long as it didn’t just return from being out of phase, at the start of the phase spider’s turn, roll a d6 to see which of its phase and teleport abilities it can access that turn.  The spider doesn’t have to use the available ability and can attack normally, if it wishes.

abilities.name: 1-2: Short teleport
abilities.effect: As a move action, the spider can teleport anywhere it can see nearby.

abilities.name: 3: Long teleport
abilities.effect: As a move action, the spider can teleport anywhere it can see nearby or far away.

abilities.name: 4-5: Phase out
abilities.effect: As a move action, the spider can remove itself from the battlefield, returning on its next initiative turn anywhere it choose nearby.  It doesn’t get to make a phase roll at the start of its next turn though.

abilities.name: 6: Teleport away
abilities.effect: If the spider has stolen at least one magic item, as a move action it can teleport back to its lair, or to its master if it has one.  It leaves the battle.  If it hasn’t stolen an item yet, it won’t leave and can use its choice of the other abilities this turn.

abilities.name: Stolen items
abilities.effect: If the spider is slain before it leaves battle, all items stolen from the party are recovered.  If a d20 roll results in a 20, other magic items are found.

extraEffects.effect: The rakshasa can make a rend mind attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Striped lightning bolts
attacks.damage: 25 lightning damage, or 50 lightning damage against a staggered target

extraEffects.effect: The rakshasa can make a rend mind attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Rend mind
attacks.damage: 15 psychic damage, and the target is confused (make a basic or at-will attack vs. ally) until the end of the rakshasa’s next turn

abilities.name: Shapechange
abilities.effect: As a standard action, the rakshasa can change its form to that of any humanoid, or back to its own shape.  Seeing through the shapechange requires a DC 25 skill check.

nastierSpecials.name: Master of chaos
nastierSpecials.effect: The rakshasa gains a bonus to all defences equal to the current number of confused enemies in the battle.

nastierSpecials.name: Reversal of fate
nastierSpecials.effect: Once per day as a quick action, the rakshasa steals the escalation die; until the end of the battle the rakshasa gains an attack bonus equal to the die’s value when it was stolen.  Reset the escalation die to 0 for the players and increase it normally with each new round.

extraEffects.effect: Increase the escalation die by 1, and the target is hampered (makes only basic attacks) until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Barbed crossbow
attacks.target: one nearby enemy, or a far away enemy at -2 atk

abilities.name: Blood frenzy
abilities.effect: Make a note of the escalation die when the sahuagin becomes staggered.  The sahuagin gains a bonus to its melee attacks and damage equal to the escalation die value for the rest of the battle.

abilities.name: Water breather
abilities.effect: Sahuagin breathe underwater and swim very well.

nastierSpecials.name: Demon-touched
nastierSpecials.effect: Roll a d6 on the demon abilities table.  The sahuagin gains that ability.

extraEffects.effect: The target moves down 1d3 points in initiative order, to a minimum of 1.
5 damage.

abilities.name: Press advantage
abilities.effect: The legionnaire deals +1d8 damage with its attacks against enemies that have a lower initiative than it.

extraEffects.effect: The hound leaves teeth in the wound; the target takes 5 ongoing damage, and the hound takes 1d6 damage.

abilities.name: Chomp chomp chomp
abilities.effect: Enemies with a lower initiative than the hound take a -5 penalty to disengage checks against it.

abilities.name: Skilled intercept 11+
abilities.effect: Once per round, an engaged skeletal hound can attempt to pop free and intercept an enemy moving past it.  Roll a normal save; on 11+, it succeeds.

extraEffects.effect: Damage equal to the penalty the trog’s stench currently imposes on the target.

abilities.name: Chameleon
abilities.effect: Underground, or in swamps and rivers, attacks against troglodytes by enemies who aren’t engaged with them take a -4 penalty.

extraEffects.effect: Damage equal to the penalty the trog’s stench currently imposes on the target.

attacks.name: Hissing curse
attacks.target: one nearby enemy, or a far away enemy at -2 atk
attacks.damage: 10 damage, and the target is again affect by trog stench if it had saved against the effect

extraEffects.effect: All nearby humanoids who saved against trog stench earlier in the battle are affected again by it.

abilities.name: Chameleon
abilities.effect: Underground, or in swamps and rivers, attacks against troglodytes by enemies who aren’t engaged with them take a -4 penalty.

extraEffects.effect: Damage equal to three times the penalty the trog’s stench currently imposes on the target.

abilities.name: Chameleon
abilities.effect: Underground, or in swamps and rivers, attacks against troglodytes by enemies who aren’t engaged with them take a -4 penalty.

abilities.name: Trollish regeneration 10
abilities.effect:
While a troll is damaged, its rubbery flesh heals 10 hit points at the start of the troll’s turn. It can regenerate five times per battle. If it heals to its maximum hit points, then that use of regeneration doesn’t count against the five-use limite
 When the troll is hit by an attack that deals fire or acid damage, it loses one use of its regeneration, and it can’t regenerate during its next turn.
 Dropping a troll to 0 hp doesn’t kill it if it has any uses of regeneration left.

nastierSpecials.name: Increased regeneration
nastierSpecials.effect: Increase the troll’s regeneration dice; the baseline amount a troll regenerates should run about 1/9 of its total hp, but you can go higher to be nasty.

nastierSpecials.name: Mutant
nastierSpecials.effect: Fire and acid don’t hurt the troll’s regeneration; lightning does instead.

nastierSpecials.name: Rending
nastierSpecials.effect: If both claw attacks hit the same target, the target also takes 10 ongoing damage.

extraEffects.effect: If the target is staggered, it is also hampered (makes only basic attacks) until the end of its next turn.

The target is also weakened until the end of its next turn (-4 attacks and defences).  In addition, the target expends one unused limited trait (a spell, power, or talent with a once-per-battle or daily use, but not magic item powers) of its choice.

attacks.name: Vampiric compulsion
attacks.damage: The target is confused and vulnerable ((save ends)

extraEffects.effect: The vampire can use vampiric compulsion as a free action only when a nearby enemy attacks the vampire and misses with a natural attack roll of 1-5.

abilities.name: Vampiric regeneration
abilities.effect: The vampire regenerates 1 hp per level at the start of each round indefinitely, but it turns to mist if it drops to 0 hp (see below).

abilities.name: Mist form
abilities.effect: Unless it is slain in a manner appropriate for truly killing vampires in the campaign, a vampire that drops to 0 hp drifts away to return and fight some other day.

nastierSpecials.name: Vampiric compulsion
nastierSpecials.effect: The vampire gains the use of the vampiric compulsion power.

extraEffects.effect: The vampire spawn can make a fangs attack against the target as a free action.

attacks.name: Fangs
attacks.damage: 7 damage, and a humanoid target is weakened (-4 attack and defences) until the end of the vampire spawn’s next turn

extraEffects.effect: Unless the wight is staggered, the attack also deals 8 ongoing negative energy damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Barrow-touch
nastierSpecials.effect: The wight’s attacks against enemies taking ongoing negative energy damage are against PD instead of AC and have an expanded crit range expands by 2.

extraEffects.effect: The target is also weakened (save ends).

attacks.name: Spiraling assault
attacks.damage: 10 negative energy damage, and after the attack the wraith teleports to and engages with one target it hit

extraEffects.effect: The wraith can use spiraling assault only when the escalation die is even.

abilities.name: Ghostly
abilities.effect:
The creature has resist damage 16+ to all damage (including holy damage) except force damage, which damages it normally.
 A wraith can move through solid objects, but it can’t end its movement inside them.

nastierSpecials.name: Drain life
nastierSpecials.effect: The wraith heals half the damage it deals when it hits with a natural 18+ attack roll.

extraEffects.effect: The wyvern can make a deadly tail stinger attack during its next turn.

attacks.name: Deadly tail stinger
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and the target takes 10 ongoing poison damage (difficult save ends, 16+)

nastierSpecials.name: Escalating poison
nastierSpecials.effect: Add the escalation die to the wyvern’s ongoing poison damage whenever that damage is dealt.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 6d10 damage!

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: A critical hit against a giant zombie mook deals triple damage instead of the normal double damage for a crit.

abilities.name: Double-strength mook
abilities.effect: The giant zombie mook counts as two 9th level mooks when you are building battles.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 1d6 damage!

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: A critical hit against a zombie drops it to 0 hp.

nastierSpecials.name: Eat brains
nastierSpecials.effect: More dangerous zombies don’t try to kill the moving targets before feasting on brains; they keep attacking any enemy they’ve knocked unconscious, rolling attacks againt the helpless enemy until it’s dead.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 1d4 damage!

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: A critical hit against a zombie shuffler deals triple damage instead of the normal double damage for a crit.
